website_summaries.verdict: Its impressive design, lightweight construction, and manufacturer-backed quality earn it a spot on our shortlist.
pros: Features handle bar pad and comfortable mini grips that even the tiniest hands can hold
The seat and handlebar heights adjust to accommodate ages 18 months to 5 years, or a 12- to 20-inch inseam (no tools required)
cons: The tires aren't made of rubber and don't seem as durable as others we reviewed

website_summaries.verdict: A durable balance bike that can handle frequent use and abuse. Sized for toddlers through preschoolers.
pros: Teaches kids to balance in just a few weeks
For ages 18 months to five years
Built-in footrests allow better balance and glide
cons: Has foam tires instead of rubber, but this means they are puncture-free and won't go flat

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for our two year old and he loves it so we love it! Super light weight and easy for him to manage. After reading the reviews I was a bit apprehensive about the foam wheels but they are super lightweight and no flats! So they really are perfect for him. I like how at barely two he can manage his bike independently. Adds to his level of confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Lorah868

customer_reviews.title: but this was a great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son loves this bike. He had issues leaning how to pedal with a regular bike, so this was a cheap way for him to at least get the idea that a bike goes forward and fast! Not an issue now, but this was a great learning tool. The wheels are the best part, cause they never need to be inflated. They are hard and durable polymer/rubber combo. This bike is best used on FLAT concrete or asphalt. There are NO BREAKS, so be careful on hills. I take my son to a small local skate park with plenty of flat land for him to ride on and it's very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor C.

customer_reviews.title: A+++ Best first bike!..  Add to cart
customer_reviews.text: This should be every child's 1st bike. This is our 2nd bike. My 3 year old son road his first bike very hard daily. That's 9 months heavy use. The wheels bearings wore out as to be expected with such heavy use. I chose to replace the bike instead of replacing just the wheels. Bike 2 was also rode very hard. Wheel bearings also lasted for about 9 months. My son got a new bike but still would rather ride his old bike with wobble wheel. A+++
customer_reviews.author: L Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Assembly caution!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Caution!!️!!️!!️ No written instructions for assembling but the pictures are easy to follow. My caution is about a preassembled piece which connects the handlebars. As I picked it up the five pieces fell apart. It took 30 minutes and much straining to get it back together. Not an easy task for a grandmother. :(. It required a lot of muscle. I wish there had been written instructions and the screw holding the parts together had been tightened before shipping with a caution not to unscrew it. Other than my nightmare assembly it seems very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Well thought of design. Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Well made bike. The frame is sturdy, the seat is decently padded and the grips are just right for my daughter. The foot rests are not to protruding which you'd think would be nice for more of a foot rest for your little one but I noticed my daughters legs would be hitting them if any wider. Well thought out bike. At its lowest setting it works for my 2 year old to push around and get going.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrios George

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it should at least have real rubber tires and not plastic ones. Seat didn't stay locked in position, kept swiveling to the sides. The assembly of the handle bar isn't intuitive and not easy to get it aligned with the wheel assembly, it always seemed a bit off. Got one for $50 at costco with real tires and stable seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strider is the best way 2 go...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old hasn't gotten off it since I gave it 2 him... he loves it...
customer_reviews.author: Jerk

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for teaching balance!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson (2 years old) after seeing a child even younger riding one. Our grandson loves it and has been riding it every chance he gets. He has always had a helmet on but I would suggest buying elbow, knee pads and gloves so that when the rider crashes, they will get right back on. Excellent for balance, which is why we purchased it as we want to put him on snow skis during ski season this year. Edit: one year + later, he’s on skis and doing great!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son when he was 15 months old. He didn't do a lot with it then except practice balancing, but now at 22 months he is riding it EVERYWHERE! It is great for working on balance and coordination and it keeps me from having to carry him! He wears himself out on this thing and I can only see it getting better as he gets older and can traverse different terrain. I personally think this type of bike is much better at teaching them balance and coordination than a regular bike with training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Currie

customer_reviews.title: No Training Wheels Needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 year old who used it during the summer of 2017 by the summer of 2018 was very confident with his balance, riding down small hills and zipping around. Because of this he easily transitioned to a bike with peddles (no training wheels) and started confidently riding on his first try! Overall the quality of the bike is great. After 2 seasons seeing lots of use everything is still in great shape and I can put it away for my next son. 2 seats and adjustable heights was useful as well.
customer_reviews.author: BanjoAndy

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike, my 5 1/2 year old, 48" tall daughter used it right out of the box. She loved it and you could immediately see her confidence shoot up. A week later, she started riding with out training wheels. Now my 17 month old takes it and walks with it.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good choice but very hard seat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Light enough to carry around the park when your child decides he wants to ride it for only 5 minutes. Don't have anything else to compare it to but it serves it's purpose and we are happy with it. 2018 update: Now that my son is older he wants to ride it more but won't because this seat is very hard. We will have to buy a different seat for it. The description says 'padded seat' but it isn't. The classic bike his friend has does have a padded seat. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lmom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Job
customer_reviews.text: Upd: It's been two years since I purchased it (2018) to my 2 y.o. daughter. Unfortunately, she wasn't interested in biking at 2 y.o. but started at the age of 3. She's almost 4 now and, damn, she's so good and fast at this. Just make sure to calculate the right size for your kid weight and height. I've seen some comparisons about Woom 1, but frankly, this is all subjective, since all kids are different. My daughter is happy with this balancing bike, so we are - the parents
customer_reviews.author: Marat

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost!
customer_reviews.text: I had considered buying a different balance bike that wasn't so expensive. My niece and nephew each had a different (cheaper) brand of bike and both of their bikes seemed great. But I decided to splurge and go with the Strider bike (purchased a year and a half ago) and I'm very glad I did! Since that time my niece's and nephew's bikes have worn badly- on one bike the bearings wore out and couldn't be fixed. The Strider, however, has held up to a lot of abuse! My 3 year old easily transitioned to a pedal bike without training wheels after a year and a half on the Strider.
customer_reviews.author: honda400

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner bike
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how easy it is to assemble.. My dad was the one to set the bike up. The tires are plastic (but I knew that before ordering). My daughter just turned two years old and is short for her age. You can adjust the seat lower than most other scoochie bikes I have come across (which is perfect). It also makes for a great prop in photos! My daughter is a little afraid of her new “bike.” But I have no doubt that, over time, she will come to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Learn Balance and Ride Faster Without Training Wheels
customer_reviews.text: We read about this product on a blog as a great way to get your child riding faster without training wheels. Our first child learned with training wheeled bikes and our second with a strider. Our second child definitely is advancing faster. Also they seem to have better control and be able to ride faster. Keep in mind this isn't a ride with your parents type bike. This is more of a your parents walk and you ride stage bike option. Also very durable - my kids just throw these down on concrete all the time and they look great. Light weight to carry for us poor parents who end up having to cart them around.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Watts

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old son has been jealous of his 4.5yo sister’s bike so we got him this. He’s obsessed. He’s about 33 inches and can just barely walk with his feet flat with the seat and handle bars at the lowest settings. He thinks it’s the greatest thing ever. Super easy to put together, took minutes. I am not a fan of the foam tires, I was under the impression they were real rubber tires, but these are like compressed foam like a fishing bobber. They’re fine for now since all he does is walk with it, but I’m wondering if they might chip away and get chewed up from dirt/rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Undecided.
customer_reviews.text: So far the strider has been a great purchase. My son is learning how to use the bike but will take some time. Honestly I debated buying this but my son wasn’t strong enough to go a full rotation on a regular mini bike. I would suggest trying to teach your kid on a regular mini bike if available and if they can push themselves I would stick with that. My sons mini bike I installed training wheels. The strider doesn’t have any this teaching balance. So either was he will have to eventually have to learn balance whether this or the mini bike worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It was a nice balance bike...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my 3 year old grandson liked this a lot, at least for the first few weeks until my daughter backed the SUV over it! The frame held up pretty well but the tires and rims are all bent up. The tires are made of a soft plastic and the rims are a hard plastic. Once deformed, they can't be straightened as you might be able to do with a metal rim. Good luck finding a replacement wheel at a descent price.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: Peeling stickers.
customer_reviews.text: Great balance bike, bought for my 3 kids oldest being 5 and he just barely makes the cuts. Seems to have improved in balancing although since purchase I haven't had him use his regular bike. My main gripe was during purchase I noticed part of the primary strider sticker on the side frame was peeling off on opening the box, and just stuck it back together. Weeks later it noticeably isn't sticking anymore which is unfortunate, hence the star drop. Highly recommended otherwise and hoping my kid will be off his training wheels sooner than later
customer_reviews.author: Erick G

customer_reviews.title: Frame was bent.
customer_reviews.text: We are going to give it one star because when we were going to assemble, it was bent! We waited to open it because it was an Easter gift. Very disappointed that such a high end item would come bent like this. We would like to exchange, but the return window closed only two days ago. big bummer. Check your items as soon as you receive them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Our 4 year old son loves this new bike so ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old son loves this new bike so much. This is replacing a Toot Scoot that he is outgrowing. The only reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is the tires dont have much tread at all. I dont think it will take very long at all to completely wear all the tread off the tires and then they will be smooth. I dont understand why there is not much tread on the tires. Other than that... 5 star all the way.
customer_reviews.author: cab door man

customer_reviews.title: Never use training wheels; use this bike
customer_reviews.text: A friend swears by these bikes for teaching his kids to ride bikes well early. Your child never develop the mental crutch of training wheels. Instead, they learn the balance of only have 2 wheels. Making the transition to pedals is significantly easier. Our toddler loves this bike. It gets his energy out, develops his brain, and gets me exercise jogging behind him! The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is there are no brakes. Your child has to use their feet to stop the bike. If they get to going really fast down a hill, this can be dangerous. You have to be close by to help stop them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kid right after his first birthday. It has been, and still is one of his favorite toys. He is 2 1/2 now, and is still hauling butt on this bike. Around 2 he figured out how to get going at a good pace and raise his feet off the ground. On a slight incline he can coast with no feet for as long as gravity will propel him. I think we're going to be able to completely avoid training wheels when he moves up to a pedal bike next year.
customer_reviews.author: neoxaero

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Ride
customer_reviews.text: My baby started a little before 18 months, so she was just walking it. But as she got closer to 18 months she got more confident with it. She can do it by herself, I just keep her straight or steer her away from the ditch or when I want her to turn around. I can see her enjoying it again more once the winter is over :) The wheels roll smoothly, and the steering seems easy. The seat is adjustable, and you can do it on the spot with no tools, easy.
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning balance
customer_reviews.text: We got this three months ago for our daughter, who was 2 1/2 years old. She wanted to ride it right away! She just walked for a couple weeks straddling it. Then she started trying to balance and go faster. Now she’s so fast I have to jog to keep up! Her balance is great. I am looking forward to seeing when she’ll be ready for a peddle bike. She seems much more comfortable than kids I see using training wheels on a peddle bike.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on a new one. Buy used. These things are durable so they last. Also because the kids outgrow them so quickly you only end up using it for a few months. (At least that’s all we did). Balance bikes are good but honestly they don’t help your kid learn to peddle and they start to rely on coasting (again in my experience). Just my 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: Kajsa Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: 2+ year olds love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this on her second birthday, and she took to it right away. She was able to figure out balance, and now can go pretty fast on it. It's grown with her as she has gotten taller, and she will be ready for a "real" bike with no problem in a year or so. It's also super sturdy and has held up extremely well to a toddler's energy. The tires look practically new, eventhough she rides it all the time. I know I'll be able to use this bike for kid #2 and #3 when they get old enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my 4 year old.
customer_reviews.text: My daughters always been into her Razor scooter. After seeing little girls on bikes she gained an interest so we began researching bikes. I settled on a balance bike but was worried about finding the right size for her since most kids get balance bikes around 2 years old. We decided on this model for my daughters 4th birthday and it fits her very well. Not too small like I was worried. It’s very easy for her and she will probably want a pedal bike real soon.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: My daughter LOVES her bike!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7, but has dwarfism. I've been searching and searching for a bike that she can handle that is small enough as well. Otherwise, it would fit an average height child that is around 2 or 3 years old. This is perfect for her. She's only had it a couple of weeks and has already learned how to balance. She takes it everywhere and can now ride around with her friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike for 2 year olds
customer_reviews.text: My son taught himself to ride in about 10 minutes. Before you know it, you are chasing after the two year old as they take off down the block. So make sure you have some good running shoes - buy this bike and you will be off to the races! Seriously, this is how kids teach themselves to ride a bike - they start off walking along with their legs and then start picking up their feet and balancing. My now 3 year old son is standing on the bike balancing - he is ready for a pedal bike after 1 year on this stride bike.
customer_reviews.author: Bmore Raven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect birthday present
customer_reviews.text: The bike is easy to assemble and very well made. I was hesitant to buy with no training wheels or pedals but my 3year old hopped on it and started to learn how to ride it. I like it how light it is and she can grab it her self and pick it up. Very nice bike:))
customer_reviews.author: Alya

customer_reviews.title: Daughter rides it constantly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike. Bought for 18 month son...he's really small for his age so he doesn't quite reach. 4 year old daughter rides it every single day numerous times...inside and out. She was pretty horrible at it at first...now she zooms around, cuts tight circles, stops on a dime. Her confidence is through the roof on it. We recently transitioned her to her normal training wheel bike (took off training wheels) and she could do it! It's easy to move the seat and handle bars up and down. Everything about it is holding up great. We would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor material
customer_reviews.text: The seat on this bike I purchased for my son is falling a part and missing chuncks out of it and he has only had it for a week. Not sure why his seat is falling apart when it's supposed to be sturdy enough to be outside and suppised to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase. My 2.5 year old started using one of our neighbors and we eventually decided to just get him his own. It’s amazing how quickly he went from just walking with the bike to pushing off and balancing on it. I feel like it will be an easy transition from this to a real bike, without ever messing with training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: HLock

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret buying this
customer_reviews.text: Great balance bike! My boys started using it before they turned two, and still going strong at 4. It’s lightweight (compare to other ones we tried). We also own regular Strider and this Sport version is better, seat can go higher. Only thing we weren’t sure about were tires, they feel more slippery that regular Air filled rubber ones, but haven’t had an issue with it. Overall very happy w Strider
customer_reviews.author: Lana K

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged and not usable
customer_reviews.text: Came damaged and not usable, I've asked for replacement. One star for now. If replacement will be good then I'll change my review
customer_reviews.author: Oxana

customer_reviews.title: absolutely nothing bad to say about this bike
customer_reviews.text: Wow, absolutely nothing bad to say about this bike. I just got it a week ago and my son already puts up his feel and rolls down hills. He caught on so fast and he loves riding his bike everyday. Love that he can pick it up himself because it's super lightweight. Please start your little ones here instead of bikes with training wheels. I love seeing my son learning to balance and you'll love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Jennings

customer_reviews.title: 18 month old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son wondering if he wouldn't be too young yet (he was 18 months at the time) but he picked up on it VERY quickly and I have a feeling it is going to give him a few years of solid enjoyment. Probably the best investment we've made in entertainment for him so far.
customer_reviews.author: The Mad Papist

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice way for him to practice and still be able ...
customer_reviews.text: Took a while for my 2 year-old to take to it, but once he did....he is striding everywhere. Zooming around the house, we take it with us when we go certain places, because its so light. We live in the country, gravel driveway and bikes can be hard to ride, let alone learn out here. This is a nice way for him to practice and still be able to go through the grass and gravel with balance. The tires not being rubber, may be my favorite part. He loves it! Great investment if you get it early enough.
customer_reviews.author: teresa whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Tires wear quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought the strider for the name and reputation and reviews. My almost 3 year old kicked ass on 2 other balance bikes that were given too him...So, I bought this new strider. So, naturally, he immediately put miles on this new balance bike within the first week. The only thing I'm disappointed in...the tires wear very quickly...I'm not impressed with how quickly the "rubber" knobby tires got bald... We have another hand-me over wooden balance bike that was heavily used, and the tires are still like new.... i just maybe swapping the tires.....
customer_reviews.author: Agentmulderm

customer_reviews.title: Great bike to grow into!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike as a birthday gift for our 2 year old. The seat and handle bar both adjust to accommodate growing little people. Very sturdy and the tires do not require air. The bike is a little on the heavy side so it has taken our 2 year old a little practice to be able to pick the bike back up to standing. This is the second Strider bike we have purchased for our kids and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old son loves this bike. He ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves this bike. He has had zero experience on bikes, yet after I put this together for him and sized to to about where I thought it should be, he swung his leg over and was walking it around the house immediately. I was impressed with how natural it seemed to be for him to just push it around. Next thing I knew he was actually sitting on the seat and walking it around and trying to coast small distances. I can't wait to get him outside on it more this spring/summer since he got it for his birthday in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: We were so impressed with how well the bike was made and how easy it was to put together
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 3 year old boy and he will not stop riding! We were so impressed with how well the bike was made and how easy it was to put together. Our son can pick it up himself and can get going really fast - even without pedals. I think our transition to a pedal bike in a few years will hopefully be a breeze. The only word of caution is make sure you keep the handlebar connection tightened because they will get loose with regular loose (it is designed to be adjustable as they grow - just have to make sure everything stays aligned).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little bike !
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike !! Just purchased for my 2.5 year old ! Absolutely perfect. Wish I had purchased sooner ! Also I made a boo boo with the assembly ( hint: don’t over tighten the handlebar assembly) and called the company directly to get a replacement part - they called me back the next day and sent the replacement part for free!!
customer_reviews.author: WEM

customer_reviews.title: Although much over the age limit, my 8 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Although much over the age limit, my 8 year old was playing on this rolling down the driveway for one week, and after I convinced her to try her 2-wheel bike, she had FINALLY learned how to ride it!! Playing with this gave her the confidence that she could actually balance on her own. My 2 year old uses by just walking it around, but she loves using her bike and enjoys being able to 'ride' this on the street with her sister!
customer_reviews.author: FLmomma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect starter bike! Great quality and adjusts to fit the age ranges listed. It will take us a little bit to realize our legs hold us up on the bike, but she will get there! She is almost 2!
customer_reviews.author: JBry23

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike for 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness— this has been such a great summer buy. My little boy is only 2 and 1/2, but he loves riding this around the house. He’s gotten SO good at it in just a couple months, and he’s already starting to pick up his feet and balance while he’s going fast. (He rides at the park, too, but it’s super hot here. So, we let him ride inside on the hard floors.) There were more expensive bikes, but we have loved this one. I think it was a prefect first bike for him!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: These bikes are amazing. They are very strong and my kids ride ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Strider for my son 2 years ago and had to buy another one. These bikes are amazing. They are very strong and my kids ride them almost every day during the summer months. In fact, two of my neighbors bought them for their kids after trying ours. We never bought a tricycle for them...we started off with these striders. I love how it teaches kids how to balance. My kids first started off walking and not sitting on the bike, but after they felt comfortable, they started to sit and ride. I highly recommend this bike to start out versus a tricycle.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his “bike”. I was skeptical about spending so much money on this thing, but my baby wants to ride it all the time. It’s amazing how quickly little ones grasp the concept, and he’ll be able to ride it for a couple of years. It’s well made, easy to assemble and adjust. If you’re on the fence, don’t be. It’s an absolute delight watching my son experience this sort of independence.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth ehrmann

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon for all you did getting the best bike out there and color my Son wanted .
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for my Grandson last Christmas .My Son is a Pro BMX ride .He knows his bike .Picky Son wanted Silver, a number one on the front .Amazon did not have the bike,they did all the work at no charge went out of their way to make sure it was what he wanted ,also shipped in time for Christmas.Beautiful bike.Top of the line.Sad part about it we only seen pictures of him opening bike.The bike being silver cost more .We believe he returned it for the money .
customer_reviews.author: Sunny4u

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this bike!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike!! Or should I say my son loves the bike. He just turned 2 and his height is average for his age, and the bike is perfect for his height, with plenty of room to grow. And I really like the additional seat with extended post so he can use it longer as he gets older. Would definitely recommend spending the extra money and getting the sport just for the extra seat and the clamps to easily adjust the seat and handle height. The bike doesn't weight much; my son can easily pick the bike up off the ground, but it's very sturdy. I've already recommended it to plenty of friends with kids.
customer_reviews.author: RISSJ3

customer_reviews.title: best bike to learn riding on
customer_reviews.text: The main thing about riding the bike is the sense of balance. I was very skeptical when my wife got a bike without pedals, but its on point. My boy got comfortable riding it and letting go his feet from the ground and when he actually tried to ride a bike with pedals, no falling no freaking out, he just got it.
customer_reviews.author: The Aazads

customer_reviews.title: and he looks like he could start a regular bike any day
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old panicked every time we took his training wheels off. 2 afternoons on this and he was ready for his big boy bike collecting dust in the garage since Xmas. Now my 2 year old has adopted it, and he looks like he could start a regular bike any day. We should have avoided a little bike with training wheels all together!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Came USED!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike brand new and it’s clearly used. This wouldn’t be an issue if they lowered the price or discounted it. But if I’m paying full price for a product, I expect it to be new and clearly not used quite a bit. The tread marks on the wheels are worn down.
customer_reviews.author: Joshton Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great option for balance bike!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this balance bike for my grandson's 2nd birthday. At first he just walked it straddling the seat. Every day he became more adept. Within 3 months he was able to balance and pick up his feet while riding (foot pedaling). I purchased this brand and model because it weighed only 5.3#. Not a struggle to ride since it was very manageable because of the light weight. It comes with a second seat for older toddlers. Was very easy to assemble with seat and handle bars, no tools necessary.
customer_reviews.author: kllucci

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: This bike will help your kids to gain their balance so much faster than trikes or training wheels. Great quality and in the unlikely event that you need parts, they are readily available. The main difference in this balance bike is that it is significantly lighter than the others that I looked at. This allows the kids to focus on balancing themselves as opposed to trying to keep a heavy bike upright. Sidenote, please make sure that you buy your child a good quality helmet.
customer_reviews.author: MWillow

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves this
customer_reviews.text: This bike is so much more versatile than one with training wheels. My grandson can't wait for bike riding to begin again after winter. I'm sure there will need to be some seat adjustment but that's the advantage of a bike that grows with you. He was two when he started riding it, can't wait to see him on it this year as a three-year-old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best introduction to bikes, and a quality build.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my two year old, was seriously impressed with how easy it was to assemble and how sturdy it is once assembled. I bought the black color and the bike looks clean and sharp. My son is learning how to balance and move the bike forward, I can adjust the seat heat easily as well as the handle bars. No crazy tool required.
customer_reviews.author: Mia B

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for my 2 year grandson
customer_reviews.text: Grandson just turned two. The balance bike will take awhile for toddlers to learn how to use. He has started using for few minutes to longer now. Really enjoys it and we keep encouraging him. The only thing we have notice we have to tighten the screw because every time we adjust it by the clip it goes down to the previous height.
customer_reviews.author: shar

customer_reviews.title: A great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: My little guy is three and tall for his age, but the pedal bikes were frustrating for him. He jumped on this bike and gained instant confidence because he could go forward without any trouble. It is not a bother to carry on walks with him if he gets tired of riding on it. The handlebars and seat both have an easily adjustable mechanism that does not seem to slip down with the weight of my child.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Faye McNeal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bike for our son's 2nd birthday. He was able to get on the bike and ride immediately. Its really easy to learn to scoot on the bike. As time has passed, he has become really proficient and can ride stretches with his feet in the air. This is a balance bike with no pedals. It is different from what most people may understamd, but the concept is great. Your child will only focus on balancing initially amd then can go straight to pedaling with training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: MDAWG32

customer_reviews.title: Best bike for every kids “first”!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Strider balance bike for my 14 month old grandson and was worried it would be too high. If you measure your little one from the crutch down you’ll have a better idea if it’s a good fit. He’s small (30% in height) for his age but this bike worked like a charm. It’s so sturdy that he figured it out immediately and loves to ride it. Great first bike for every little one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Got this little strider bike for my 2 year old grandson. He LOVES it! He hardly ever gets off of it, and now he cruises down dirt piles and chases the goats on it! Haha. Very sturdy little bike, and easy to put together. Great for learning balance and control. When he gets a pedal bike, I doubt he will even need training wheels. They live in the country, and the wheels are great for their sandy roads too.
customer_reviews.author: Jace Reid

customer_reviews.title: This is my sons favorite toy we bought for his second birthday
customer_reviews.text: This is my sons favorite toy we bought for his second birthday. I am taking this bike everywhere with us now. The Strider 12 is light, doesn't take up much room so it is easy to the store, lake, parks etc... I am confident that when my son reaches three he will be onto a peddle bike, and the transition will be smooth and natural. If you feel this isn't the right bike for your current situation just youtube "Strider bike" and watch how children react to the bike. Building your kids motor skill's young will only help your child in the long run. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Balance Bike!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start by saying I have never actually written reviews for any product before...and I buy online A LOT! This product is worthy of my first review ever, it is THAT GOOD! My son is 2 years and 4 months and has only been ridding this bike for 5 days. We take maybe 20 minute rides (have only done 4-5) And he’s already starting to push himself and balance lifting his legs. It is absolutely amazing that a child this young would pick up this quickly! Thank you strider for this amazing bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Lina A Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Kids hated it.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. It's just a weird scooter. Kids hated it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Two-year old loved this
customer_reviews.text: Well, she loved it after she turned around to face the handle bars! :) After that she figure out how to push it, sit on it, and turn it. She could lay it down and pick it up. The bike is smaller than I thought, but the seat and handle bars have enough length so this will definitely grow with her. Also has extra extension. I thought it was a bit expensive, but it was good quality.
customer_reviews.author: kimmba

customer_reviews.title: Love Strider
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality bike. Dealt with Strider customer service directly to get a replacement clamp. Jennifer was beyond friendly and went above and beyond to assist, and to get me the clamp quickly. Very impressed with the customer service from Strider. (Called Amazon first and was told me to send the entire bike backfor new clamp).
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars on everything. Light, easy to put together, very sturdy. I got lime green and love the color. My 2 year old wont use it of course, because two year olds can be tiny terrorists, but thats nothing on the bike. You wont regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardee Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short legs!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for short legs! My daughter is short with teeny tiny legs. This bike fits her with room to spare. We've borrowed other bikes from neighbors, and some can not go low enough. I love that the handlebar and seat can be loosened and tightened by hand (without tools). Tires are solid rubber so no filling with air. All-in-all, a very smart design. Now, let's see if she can stop smashing into things... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Tim Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This a very sturdy bike. My 2 year-old granddaughter loves it. She is on the tiny side but the seat lowers enough so her feet touch the ground. It also came with an extra seat mount that is longer so she can continue to use the bike as she gets taller.
customer_reviews.author: wpoole

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bike that I purchase, bought one for my son about a year ago when he turned two and I just bought another for my nephew. We love it, great way to learn how to balance on a bike. I wish I had one of these as a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas L

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids to Learn to Ride Bike
customer_reviews.text: My grandson originally had one that was bought used off a neighborhood site that the wheel came off and I bought this one figuring my younger grandson was coming up the rear anyway. Very lightweight, sturdy, hours and hours of fun riding around. After practicing to pedal with bike for half hour the training wheels came off in minutes and he was riding away into the distance. What I liked on walks when my grandson did get tired it was so light I could put on top of stroller and he was able to climb in.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep her off of it when she comes to visit and it is amazing how she is balancing as well
customer_reviews.text: Got this bike for our granddaughter's 3rd birthday and she absolutely adores it. Can't keep her off of it when she comes to visit and it is amazing how she is balancing as well. Would recommend this highly for a great gift plus getting exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Edna L Hersperger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased a cheaper brand balance bike. Big mistake. That bike was missing pieces so we returned it and purchased the Strider. So happy we did! It took 5 minutes to put together. Grandson is turning two and LOVES THIS BIKE. I’m exhausted trying to keep up with him as he rides. He didn’t want to stop riding. Great bike!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Noble

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: First of all SUPER FAST SHIPPING! Ordered Sunday night and it arrived by Wednesday with free shipping option. Estimate was 10 days. The Strider is amazing. I was worried my 3.5 year old would be too big but it’s a perfect fit. She is picking it up quickly and loves it. Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, just my kid won't use it.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, but my daughter (3.5) refuses to ride claiming it's broken due to having no pedals or training wheels. I presume you should get them this when younger than mine as she already had a expectation of what a bike is and won't ride it due to that expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A MUST FOR TODDLERS
customer_reviews.text: My twin boys absolutely love these balance bikes. They’ve learned how to balance so well, and I know the transition to a pedal bike will be way easier than if they hadn’t started on these. My only complaint is that I wish the wheels were rubber for better grippage. However, I truly believe a Strider is the one to get if you’re looking at balance bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for an 18 month old...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this for my daughters 2yr b-day... she's way too small for it and she's a big kid. I would say this is ideal for a 3yr old. it's cute and appears to be well made, but their age demographic is way off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Grandaughters 3rd Birthday! She feels like a big kid riding without training wheels. Great way to teach good balance early. Plan to purchase another for my house. Item arrived quickly and very easy to put together. Bike is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: SDWin61

customer_reviews.title: Well built but our 26 month old just can’t do it
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars for quality of the bike. We bought this for our 26 month old grandson. He is small for his age, but is very coordinated. He just couldn’t balance on it. Maybe it’s because of his size, I’m not sure. The bike is well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: 3 yr old loves this bike
customer_reviews.text: My guy is 3.5 years old, and loves this bike. its a great way for him to learn. He also wishes he could keep up with the big kids on other wheeled toys, so this is a good way for him to gain the muscles and skill before leveling up.
customer_reviews.author: emhal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome freedom for son.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! 2 year old is killing it on this bike. Day 1 waved and said bye as he rode (walked it) out of the driveway as his 11 yr old brother had done on his bike. Within minutes was getting around great. He falls but can get himself and the bike up. Within a few times of walk riding he is now riding it and almost has it balanced. He was 22 months.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Rickard

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike!
customer_reviews.text: We got our son this bike for his 2nd birthday and it was a big hit!! He's going on 3 now and still enjoys riding it from time to time but he does prefer a peddle trike more, hoping next summer we can work on it more for balance!
customer_reviews.author: Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great bike! - Very light - my 4 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! - Very light - my 4 year old found it very easy to use and carry around - Very easy to assemble and adjust. I adjusted the seat and handle a few times My son learned to balance within a couple of months on this, and can now ride a regular bike without training wheels. Thanks Strider!
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Best method to teach your child to ride a bike
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son was struggling with using a traditional pedal bike so we picked up one of these strider bikes and could not be more happy we did! The build quality is excellent and feels very sturdy. My only regret is not getting him one earlier. He loves using it and I see his balance getting better almost every time he uses it. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Denesowicz

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It works well and comes with an extended pole for a higher seat. Easy to put together, easy to use. She does hit her feet on the frame sometimes, but all in all it is a good little unit. Was too big for her at 2 even at lowest setting, but now that she's 3 it fits pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Curt S. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old but now my 9 year old is using it to learn how to ride. He’s wanted nothing to do with bikes until now. I bet the 14X would’ve been easier ( a little bigger) but I’m excited. One bike to teach both kids! Great bike!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: New idea to me, but really helps kids balance!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them. This idea is new to me, and I still wonder if a "balance bike" is just another way to make money in the interim between trike and real bike, but, I'm coming around to the idea that it really helps kids with balance before the training wheels. Saw my grand daughter do real well with this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S. Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his bike! I gave it to him at 22 months. Just a few weeks later he was already figuring out how to use it correctly. He feels like a big boy riding his bike through the neighborhood and I live watching him build confidence in his control over the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Rachy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. My three-yr old looked at it and announced ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. My three-yr old looked at it and announced it needed pedals, so he refused to try it out. I wheeled it around for less than 30 seconds before he jumped on and took off. He hasn't stopped since. The bike is extremely light which is great because I have to drag it along when his attention is distracted. Yet it's durable enough for a destructive toddler whose greatest joy is running over his toys. Best "toy" to date!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great quality balance bike
customer_reviews.text: Adorable! Seems well made. Didn't take my husband long to put together for Christmas morning surprise. My almost 3 year old knew right away what to do to ride it. Light weight for her and easy for her to maneuver. Can't wait to get it outside for her to ride! Didn't realize the tires aren't your typical rubber bike tires. Interested to see how they wear from use on neighborhood street.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 year old for his birthday, and he absolutely loves it! He doesn’t quite have it down yet, but we can already see the impact it’s having towards balance training. The wheels are great quality (something I was worried about), and the seat and handles are easy to adjust. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas Hamelin

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grandson has to take this everywhere. He absolutely loves it. Well built sturdy. Perfect for balance training. I’m sure he will transition easily to a bike when he is older
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: After hearing great reviews for balance bikes, we decided to get one for my son who is 2! He is quickly getting the hang of it! I really like how easy it is to adjust the height of the bike. That will be needed as he is a growing boy! I am hoping that this will help us bypass training wheels and move straight to a big boy bike in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylea

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for balance
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My 15 month old loves it! He is too small to ride himself but can't wait for him to get a little bigger. My older son had one and never needed training wheels when he learned to ride a bike!
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: great little bike!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this bike. He's still just barely scooting along, but he's learning quickly to keep his balance (assuming he stays focused enough to stay on the bike and not get distracted by crunching dried up leaves).
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think about it, just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is amazing, got it for my 2 year old on his birthday. He absolutely loves it and is great on it! I remember learning to ride with training wheels when I was like 5! These things teach balance and confidence WAY earlier! So glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at balancing bikes since my kid was a year old. I got it when he was 18 as per the recommend age. Now he's 26 months and what a progress! I was very happy to see him improve every single time we go out. At the beginning my son wasn't very interested and would constantly leave it on the ground and go on foot. but now he would ride all day of I had the time, never gets bored. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Wildcat

product_meta.title: Strider - 12 Sport Balance Bike, Ages 18 Months to 5 Years
product_meta.description: Encourage your child to ride with a Strider Bike. When learning to ride, a child must be allowed to experience the feel of leaning and how steering affects the balance of the bike. When a child learns to ride without leaning, such as on a tricycle or bike with training wheels, they aren't really learning to ride at all. With the help of a balance bike, the child can learn how to balance and ride a bike in the most simplest way.
feature_bullets: JOIN THE STRIDER FAMILY - Meet the bike that set the world on fire and revolutionized the way kids learn to ride. Children as young as one are experiencing the thrill of riding without training wheels before they’re out of diapers.
GROWS WITH YOUR CHILD - The seat and handlebar heights adjust to accommodate ages 18 months to 5 years, or a 12– 20 in. inseam (no tools required).

FOR YOUNG KIDS - Weighing in at only 3.0 kg (6.7 lbs.), the 12 Sport push bike makes it easy for your boy or girl to ride and stride. Mini-grips mean your child’s little mitts can easily take control. This bike gives you the biggest bang for your buck!

IT’S MORE THAN JUST A RIDING TOY - Boring specs aside, this is the bike that introduces kids to the freedom, power, and responsibility of riding. Now they have the power to keep up with you when you’re out and about, experiencing amazing freedom.

YEARS OF FUN - We know kids put things through rigorous…*ahem*…testing. With the 12 Sport's durable steel frame and puncture-proof tires, you don't have to worry about damage or maintenance and have a child’s bike they won’t outgrow in a few months.
